doc.title: MFOLD
doc.reference: M. Zuker, D.H. Mathews and D.H. Turner Algorithms and Thermodynamics for RNA Secondary Structure Prediction: A Practical Guide in RNA Biochemistry and Biotechnology, J. Barciszewski and B.F.C. Clark, eds., NATO ASI Series, Kluwer Academic Publishers, (1999)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: SEQ : The sequence file may contain multiple sequences. At present, the mfold script will fold the first sequence by default.

interface.label: RNA or DNA (NA) RNA DNA

Sequence type (LC)?
Linear Circular
It indicates whether a linear or circular nucleic acid is being folded.

xhtml:div.label: Temperature (T)

Percent (P)?
This is the percent suboptimality for computing the energy dot plot and suboptimal foldings. The default value is 5%. This parameter controls the value of the free energy increment, delta (deltaG). Delta of deltaG is set to P% of deltaG, computed minimum free energy. The energy dot plot shows only those base pairs that are in foldings with free energy minus or equal to deltaG plus delta (deltaG). Similarly, the free energies of computed foldings are in the range from deltaG to deltaG plus delta (deltaG). No matter the value of P, mfold currently keeps delta (deltaG) in the range [1,12] (kcal/mole).
Na+ molar concentration (NA_CONC)
Mg++ molar concentration (MG_CONC)

Window parameter (W)?
This is the window parameter that controls the number of foldings that are automatically computed by mfold . `W' may be thought of as a distance parameter. The distance between 2 base pairs, i.j and i'.j' may be defined as max{|i-i'|,|j-j'|}. Then if k-1 foldings have already been predicted by mfold , the kth folding will have at least W base pairs that are at least a distance W from any of the base pairs in the first k-1 foldings. As W increases, the number of predicted foldings decreases. If W is not specified, mfold selects a value by default based on sequence length.

Max base pair distance (MAXBP)?
A base pair i.j will not be allowed to form (in linear RNA) if j-i > MAXBP. For circular RNA, a base pair i.j cannot form if min{j-i,n+i-j} > MAXBP . Thus small values of MAXBP ensure that only short range base pairs will be predicted. By default, MAXBP=+infinity, indicating no constraint.
Maximum bulge/interior loop size (MAX_LP)
Maximum asymmetry of a bulge/interior loop (MAX_AS)

Maximum number of foldings to be computed (MAX)?
MAX : This is the maximum number of foldings that mfold will compute (50 by default). It is better to limit the number of foldings by careful selection of the P and W parameters.

Structure annotation type (ANN)?
No special annotation p-num ss-count
This parameter currently takes on 3 values.
- `none' : secondary structures are drawn without any special annotation. Letters or outline are in black, while base pairs are red lines or dots for GC pairs and blue lines or dots for AU and GU pairs.
- `p-num' : Colored dots, colored base characters or a combination are used to display in each folding how well-determined each base is according to the P-num values in the `fold_name.ann' file.
- `ss-count' : Colored dots, colored base characters or a combination are used to display in each folding how likely a base is to be single-stranded according to sample statistics stored in the `fold_name.ss-count' file.
Structure display mode (MODE) Auto Bases Lines
Structure rotation angle (ROT_ANG)
5' base number (START)
3' base number (STOP)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: AUX : (optional) This is the name of an auxiliary input file of folding constraints. If this parameter is not used, mfold looks for a file named `fold_name.aux'. If this file exists and is not empty, then it is interpreted as a constraint file. Thus constraints may be used without the use of this command line parameter.
Fill the box or the file with constraints (1 constraint per line) You may:
1. force bases i,i+1,...,i+k-1 to be double stranded by entering:
F i 0 k
2. force consecutive base pairs i.j,i+1.j-1, ...,i+k-1.j-k+1 by entering:
F i j k
3. force bases i,i+1,...,i+k-1 to be single stranded by entering:
P i 0 k
4. prohibit the consecutive base pairs
i.j,i+1.j-1, ...,i+k-1.j-k+1 by entering:
P i j k
5. prohibit bases i to j from pairing with bases k to l by entering:
P i-j k-l

xhtml:div.label: Text output file Yes No
Detailed output file Yes No
Html output file Yes No

RNAML output file?
Yes No
The RNAML (RNA Markup Language) was developed by a consortium of investigators and is a proposed syntax for RNA information files. A description was published in 2002:
A. Waugh, P. Gendron, R. Altman, J.W. Brown, D. Case, D. Gautheret, S.C. Harvey, N. Leontis, J. Westbrook, E. Westhof, M. Zuker, and F. Major RNAML: A standard syntax for exchanging RNA information. RNA 8 (6), 707-717, (2002)

Energy dot plot output file?
Yes No
This is a text file that contains all the base pairs on the energy dot plot , organized into helices for which Delta G(i,j) is constant. The first record is a header, and each subsequent record describes a single helix. The records are usually sorted by Delta G(i,j) and are often filtered so that short helices or isolated base pairs (helices of length 1) in suboptimal foldings are removed.
Structure annotation output file Yes No

Helix num output file?
Yes No
This file is the same as plot file, except that the energy column is replaced by an h-num column. These files are usually sorted by h-num; lowest to highest, or best determined to worst determined. Often, only helices in optimal foldings are retained.

GIF output file?
Yes No
A graphics file that ends with the suffix .gif should be displayed directly on the page of your web browser.
PDF output file Yes No

Postscript output file?
Yes No
PostScript is a programming language that is used to describe output for printing and display. It was developed by Adobe Systems. It is common to have PostScript capability on most printers. Programs such as Ghostscript, Ghostview and GSview can be used to display PostScript files(http://www.cs.wisc.edu/~ghost/").

CT output file?
Yes No
The '.ct file' contains the nucleic acid sequence and base pairing information from which a structure plot may be computed. The mfold software and mfold web servers use the "sir_graph_ng" program to create Postscript, jpg and png images from .ct files. "sir_graph_ng" is part of the mfold_util package that may be obtained here: http://www.bioinfo.rpi.edu/~zukerm/export/.

XRNA_ss output file?
Yes No
This is an input file for the XRNA program by Bryn Weiser and Harry Noller. The new Java version is available from UC Santa Cruz RNA Center web site: href="http://rna.ucsc.edu/rnacenter/xrna/xrna.html". The ss file can be regarded as an expanded ct file. It contains base and connect information as well a coordinates for plotting the bases.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: SEQ : The sequence file may contain multiple sequences. At present, the mfold script will fold the first sequence by default.
It indicates whether a linear or circular nucleic acid is being folded.

This is the percent suboptimality for computing the energy dot plot and suboptimal foldings. The default value is 5%. This parameter controls the value of the free energy increment, delta (deltaG). Delta of deltaG is set to P% of deltaG, computed minimum free energy. The energy dot plot shows only those base pairs that are in foldings with free energy minus or equal to deltaG plus delta (deltaG). Similarly, the free energies of computed foldings are in the range from deltaG to deltaG plus delta (deltaG). No matter the value of P, mfold currently keeps delta (deltaG) in the range [1,12] (kcal/mole).

This is the window parameter that controls the number of foldings that are automatically computed by mfold . `W' may be thought of as a distance parameter. The distance between 2 base pairs, i.j and i'.j' may be defined as max{|i-i'|,|j-j'|}. Then if k-1 foldings have already been predicted by mfold , the kth folding will have at least W base pairs that are at least a distance W from any of the base pairs in the first k-1 foldings. As W increases, the number of predicted foldings decreases. If W is not specified, mfold selects a value by default based on sequence length.

A base pair i.j will not be allowed to form (in linear RNA) if j-i > MAXBP. For circular RNA, a base pair i.j cannot form if min{j-i,n+i-j} > MAXBP . Thus small values of MAXBP ensure that only short range base pairs will be predicted. By default, MAXBP=+infinity, indicating no constraint.
MAX : This is the maximum number of foldings that mfold will compute (50 by default). It is better to limit the number of foldings by careful selection of the P and W parameters.
This parameter currently takes on 3 values.

- `none' : secondary structures are drawn without any special annotation. Letters or outline are in black, while base pairs are red lines or dots for GC pairs and blue lines or dots for AU and GU pairs.
- `p-num' : Colored dots, colored base characters or a combination are used to display in each folding how well-determined each base is according to the P-num values in the `fold_name.ann' file.

- `ss-count' : Colored dots, colored base characters or a combination are used to display in each folding how likely a base is to be single-stranded according to sample statistics stored in the `fold_name.ss-count' file.

AUX : (optional) This is the name of an auxiliary input file of folding constraints. If this parameter is not used, mfold looks for a file named `fold_name.aux'. If this file exists and is not empty, then it is interpreted as a constraint file. Thus constraints may be used without the use of this command line parameter.
Fill the box or the file with constraints (1 constraint per line) You may:
1. force bases i,i+1,...,i+k-1 to be double stranded by entering:
F i 0 k
2. force consecutive base pairs i.j,i+1.j-1, ...,i+k-1.j-k+1 by entering:
F i j k
3. force bases i,i+1,...,i+k-1 to be single stranded by entering:
P i 0 k
4. prohibit the consecutive base pairs
i.j,i+1.j-1, ...,i+k-1.j-k+1 by entering:
P i j k
5. prohibit bases i to j from pairing with bases k to l by entering:
P i-j k-l
The RNAML (RNA Markup Language) was developed by a consortium of investigators and is a proposed syntax for RNA information files. A description was published in 2002:

A. Waugh, P. Gendron, R. Altman, J.W. Brown, D. Case, D. Gautheret, S.C. Harvey, N. Leontis, J. Westbrook, E. Westhof, M. Zuker, and F. Major RNAML: A standard syntax for exchanging RNA information. RNA 8 (6), 707-717, (2002)

This is a text file that contains all the base pairs on the energy dot plot , organized into helices for which Delta G(i,j) is constant. The first record is a header, and each subsequent record describes a single helix. The records are usually sorted by Delta G(i,j) and are often filtered so that short helices or isolated base pairs (helices of length 1) in suboptimal foldings are removed.

This file is the same as plot file, except that the energy column is replaced by an h-num column. These files are usually sorted by h-num; lowest to highest, or best determined to worst determined. Often, only helices in optimal foldings are retained.
A graphics file that ends with the suffix .gif should be displayed directly on the page of your web browser.

PostScript is a programming language that is used to describe output for printing and display. It was developed by Adobe Systems. It is common to have PostScript capability on most printers. Programs such as Ghostscript, Ghostview and GSview can be used to display PostScript files(http://www.cs.wisc.edu/~ghost/").

The '.ct file' contains the nucleic acid sequence and base pairing information from which a structure plot may be computed. The mfold software and mfold web servers use the "sir_graph_ng" program to create Postscript, jpg and png images from .ct files. "sir_graph_ng" is part of the mfold_util package that may be obtained here: http://www.bioinfo.rpi.edu/~zukerm/export/.

This is an input file for the XRNA program by Bryn Weiser and Harry Noller. The new Java version is available from UC Santa Cruz RNA Center web site: href="http://rna.ucsc.edu/rnacenter/xrna/xrna.html". The ss file can be regarded as an expanded ct file. It contains base and connect information as well a coordinates for plotting the bases.

comment.text: AUX : (optional) This is the name of an auxiliary input file of folding constraints. If this parameter is not used, mfold looks for a file named `fold_name.aux'. If this file exists and is not empty, then it is interpreted as a constraint file. Thus constraints may be used without the use of this command line parameter.
Fill the box or the file with constraints (1 constraint per line) You may:
1. force bases i,i+1,...,i+k-1 to be double stranded by entering:
F i 0 k
2. force consecutive base pairs i.j,i+1.j-1, ...,i+k-1.j-k+1 by entering:
F i j k
3. force bases i,i+1,...,i+k-1 to be single stranded by entering:
P i 0 k
4. prohibit the consecutive base pairs
i.j,i+1.j-1, ...,i+k-1.j-k+1 by entering:
P i j k
5. prohibit bases i to j from pairing with bases k to l by entering:
P i-j k-l

Yes No
The '.ct file' contains the nucleic acid sequence and base pairing information from which a structure plot may be computed. The mfold software and mfold web servers use the "sir_graph_ng" program to create Postscript, jpg and png images from .ct files. "sir_graph_ng" is part of the mfold_util package that may be obtained here: http://www.bioinfo.rpi.edu/~zukerm/export/.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The '.ct file' contains the nucleic acid sequence and base pairing information from which a structure plot may be computed. The mfold software and mfold web servers use the "sir_graph_ng" program to create Postscript, jpg and png images from .ct files. "sir_graph_ng" is part of the mfold_util package that may be obtained here: http://www.bioinfo.rpi.edu/~zukerm/export/.

comment.text: This is an input file for the XRNA program by Bryn Weiser and Harry Noller. The new Java version is available from UC Santa Cruz RNA Center web site: href="http://rna.ucsc.edu/rnacenter/xrna/xrna.html". The ss file can be regarded as an expanded ct file. It contains base and connect information as well a coordinates for plotting the bases.

interface.label:
XRNA_ss output file?
Yes No
This is an input file for the XRNA program by Bryn Weiser and Harry Noller. The new Java version is available from UC Santa Cruz RNA Center web site: href="http://rna.ucsc.edu/rnacenter/xrna/xrna.html". The ss file can be regarded as an expanded ct file. It contains base and connect information as well a coordinates for plotting the bases.
